summary: Build a modern, professional tech-startup marketing website for “SmartBreak,” a smart electrical safety solution for real-time detection and automatic isolation of broken LV overhead conductors, using a dark-blue + electric-yellow theme, smooth animations, and engineering-focused visuals.
architectural_notes: Single-page responsive marketing site with smooth-scroll animations and reusable section components.
Use placeholder/inline SVG diagrams for infographic, system architecture, and waveform graphics; use realistic power-infrastructure imagery where applicable.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Subtle animated-style power grid / transmission line background illustration, dark-tech aesthetic (hero-grid-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Infographic illustration: broken conductor leading to live wire leading to public danger, with arrows and simple icons (problem-infographic.dim_1400x700.png)
- System architecture diagram with labeled blocks and arrows: Consumer Unit, RF Communication, Transformer Control Unit, Isolation Actuator, SMS Alert (solution-architecture-diagram.dim_1600x900.png)
- Waveform-style simulation graphic placeholder (matlab-waveform-placeholder.dim_1600x600.png)
- Realistic power distribution infrastructure hero image, night/dark, high-tech mood (power-infrastructure-photo.dim_1600x900.png)
- Impact storytelling illustration showing safer rural distribution network / protected community near power lines, professional engineering style (impact-visual.dim_1600x900.png)
- Set of 6 consistent line icons for the How It Works steps (how-it-works-icons.dim_1024x1024.png)
- Set of 6 consistent tech feature line icons for Technology & Innovation cards (tech-feature-icons.dim_1024x1024.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-page SmartBreak marketing website with 9 sections in this order: (1) Hero, (2) Problem, (3) Our Solution, (4) How It Works (6 steps), (5) Technology & Innovation, (6) Simulation & Proof, (7) Impact, (8) About/Research Background, (9) Contact.

Implement the SmartBreak visual design system across the page: deep-tech IoT + power infrastructure look, dark-blue primary background/sections with electric-yellow accents, modern sans-serif typography, clean spacing, and professional engineering styling.

Build the Hero section with the exact headline and subheadline provided, two CTA buttons (“Request Demo”, “Download Technical Brief”), and a subtle animated power grid / transmission line background visual.

Implement smooth-scroll navigation behavior for in-page section jumps and add subtle on-scroll entrance animations for key section elements (headings, cards, diagrams) optimized for pitch/demo presentation.
Build the Problem section titled “The Hidden Danger in LV Distribution Networks” with the provided bullet points and an infographic-style visual showing: Broken conductor → Live wire → Public danger.

Build the Our Solution section titled “The SmartBreak Solution” including the provided explanation bullets and a simple system architecture diagram showing: Consumer Unit → RF Communication → Transformer Control Unit → Isolation Actuator → SMS Alert.

Build the How It Works section as a 6-step horizontal flow using icons and clean layout, with these exact steps: (1) Conductor snaps, (2) Voltage loss detected at consumer end, (3) Battery-powered alert transmitted, (4) Transformer unit validates multiple alerts, (5) Isolation actuator triggered, (6) SMS notification sent to control room.

Build the Technology & Innovation section using tech-style cards with icons for each listed highlight: multi-point validation logic, false alarm reduction algorithm, AI-ready fault classification, predictive monitoring (thermal + vibration sensors), GPS-based fault localization, solar-assisted backup system.
Build the Simulation & Proof section showing “MATLAB Simulation Results” and the provided content bullets, including a waveform-style graphic placeholder.
Build the Impact section titled “Impact on Society” with the provided bullets and strong visual storytelling using realistic power infrastructure imagery.
Build the About/Research Background section including the provided description text about the project’s purpose and context.

Build the Contact section with a form containing fields: Name, Organization, Email, Message, and include two CTAs labeled “Partner With Us” and “Request Pilot Deployment”. Submitting either CTA should submit the form along with which CTA was chosen and show a success/error state.

Add static assets for placeholder diagrams/visuals and ensure the frontend renders them from the static public assets path (not via the backend). Include: hero background visual, problem infographic, solution architecture diagram, waveform graphic, and at least one power-infrastructure hero/impact visual.
